TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s father was convicted of an offence on the ground that he had kept , contrary to the regulations then in force , CARDINAL gold coins and CARDINAL silver coins of numismatic value . He was sentenced to DATE imprisonment . He was also fined and the coins were confiscated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ( Najvyšší súd ) quashed , in the context of judicial rehabilitation provided for by LAW of DATE , the judgment of CARDINAL DATE including all consequential decisions and discharged the applicant ’s late father .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant claimed the restitution of his father ’s coins under LAW of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Okresný súd ) granted the action and ordered ORG to restore the coins to the applicant . The court established , with reference to the relevant records , that the coins had been taken away from the applicant ’s father on DATE and that they had been transmitted to ORG in GPE on DATE . On DATE the coins were examined by an expert and inventoried in the premises of ORG in GPE .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of ORG judgment reads as follows :

“ It is true that the law requires that a person claiming restitution of movable property should indicate and show where such property is . However , in the present case the plaintiff undoubtedly has no possibility of inspecting the LOC or safes of the former ORG in GPE as he is not allowed to enter those LOC . By insisting that the applicant should show that the coins are at the last known place the court would impose a burden of proof on him which it is practically impossible to fulfil . On the contrary ... ORG neither showed that the former ORG in GPE had transferred the coins to a different authority nor did it propose to take evidence to that effect ...

The court established that the last time the coins ... had been held in the premises of ORG in GPE to which ORG is a successor , and it has not been shown that the coins were not in those LOC when FAC became operative , i.e. by DATE . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG appealed . Its representative argued that all relevant documents had been destroyed and that the onus of proof as regards the deposit of the coins lay on the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Krajský súd ) dismissed the applicant ’s action . It found , with reference to Sections CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) , CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE , that the applicant had failed to show where the coins had been deposited when that Act had become operative on DATE .

CARDINAL . In the judgment ORG admitted that the applicant had limited possibilities of locating his father ’s property . It therefore took further evidence of its own initiative . In particular , ORG noted that in accordance with the relevant practice the confiscated property should have been handed over to the public prosecutor and , after the relevant judgment had became final , to the financial department of the competent local government authority . ORG therefore examined the criminal file concerning the case of the applicant ’s father . It further established that the archives of ORG , of ORG , of ORG and of ORG in GPE contained no document relating to the coins in question . ORG also heard a witness who had worked at ORG of ORG in DATE . However , the latter had no knowledge of the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Najvyšší súd ) dismissed the applicant ’s appeal on points of law . It shared ORG view according to which the applicant had failed to produce evidence that the defendant Ministry was in possession of the coins as required by Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW of DATE .
CARDINAL . In the judgment ORG further stated :

“ The allegation that the movable property in question had been taken over by an employee of ORG in GPE on DATE and that ... it had been examined there by an expert on DATE can not suffice . Since then a considerable period lapsed during which the golden and silver coins in question could have been alienated , destroyed or lost . The legislator , however , explicitly included in LAW ) of FAC the obligation to show where the movable in question is at the moment of the entry into force of that law .

... it follows from logical and systematic interpretation of LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW that a restitution claim can only concern the same property which was taken over by the ORG and not a different object of the same kind . Only movable property which can be individually identified by its specific features thanks to which it cannnot be interchanged with other objects is therefore liable to restitution ... ”
CARDINAL . Act No . DATE on ORG ( PERSON o súdnej rehabilitácii ) entered into force on DATE . The relevant provisions read as follows :

“ The aim of the LAW is to authorise the quashing of convictions for offences where such convictions are incompatible with the principles of a democratic society respecting the political rights and freedoms enshrined in the LAW and set out in the international documents , ... to ensure social rehabilitation and adequate material compensation for the persons [ so ] convicted ... ”

“ CARDINAL . The conditions under which the provisions of this Act shall apply to claims resulting from quashed confiscation decisions ... as well as the manner of redress and the scope of such claims shall be defined in a special law . ”

CARDINAL . Act No . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on LAW ( PERSON o mimosúdnych rehabilitáciách ) became operative on DATE . Its preamble stipulates that it was adopted with the aim of mitigating the consequences of certain infringements of property rights as well as of other rights which occurred between CARDINAL DATE and DATE . The relevant provisions of the Extra - Judicial Rehabilitations Act read as follows :

“ CARDINAL . This Act relates to the mitigation of the consequences of certain infringements ... which arose DATE and DATE ... and which are incompatible with the principles of a NORP society respecting the rights of citizens as enshrined in the Charter of ORG , LAW and the ensuing international pacts on civil , political , economic , social and cultural rights .

CARDINAL . This Act also lays down the conditions for submitting claims resulting from quashed sentences by which property was confiscated as well as the manner of redress and the scope of such claims . ”
“ CARDINAL . Persons obliged [ to restore the property ] comprise the ORG or legal persons having confiscated property in their possession at the date when this LAW becomes operative ...
CARDINAL . Any natural person who [ unlawfully ] acquired property from the ORG is also obliged to restore such property ... ”

“ CARDINAL . A person obliged [ to make restitution ] shall restore the property upon a written request provided that the person [ claiming the property ] proves that he or she is entitled to have the property restored and shows in which way it was taken away by the ORG . CARDINAL . When the ORG acquired , on the basis of a judicial decision which was quashed under LAW no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL on Judicial Rehabilitation ... , the entire property of a citizen and when such property did not comprise real property , the person concerned is entitled to compensation in the amount of CARDINAL NORP korunas ... ”

“ CARDINAL . The persons obliged [ to restore confiscated property ] shall comprise any legal person referred to in LAW ) , any natural person referred to in LAW ) who acquired such property from the ORG where the ORG itself obtained it as a result of a judicial decision , and the competent central government authority .
